definition: old name for district of Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Having another name of Guihua temple, Songzanlin temple is a architecture group like a market town.
sentences.chinese: 松贊林寺又稱歸化寺，是一座集鎮規模的建築羣。

sentences.english: Furthermore, this article compares the temple funds in Guihua with those in Dolonnur and other regions.
sentences.chinese: 再者，比較歸化和多倫諾爾及其他地方寺廟的經費。

sentences.english: My grandfather's naturalization certificate hangs on the wall in my chambers.
sentences.chinese: 祖父的歸化證書此刻就掛在我的辦公室牆上。

sentences.english: And we’ve stemmed the increases in naturalization fees.
sentences.chinese: 我們遏止了移民歸化手續費的上漲。

sentences.english: It was sort of a process of naturalization.
Domesticating translation also has its advantages and its due range of usage.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，歸化的翻譯策略也有其長處和適用的範圍。

sentences.english: The third part centers on the theory and representative advocators of domestication and foreignization strategies.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分介紹了歸化和異化策略及其理論代表人物。

sentences.english: When I served as a Federal District Court judge, I performed the naturalization ceremony regularly.
sentences.chinese: 在聯邦地區法院任法官時，我經常主持歸化儀式。

sentences.english: There are at least 800 naturalized aliens .
sentences.chinese: 歸化的外來種起碼也有800種。

sentences.english: You were born into the dog kingdom, but I want to naturalize you into the cat kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 從前你生入了狗的國，但是我要把你歸化進入貓的國。

sentences.english: Chapter five is the further discussion about the functions of domestication and foreignization in the postcolonial context.
sentences.chinese: 進一步探討後殖民語境中歸化和異化翻譯策略的作用。

sentences.english: That is the result of interaction between Foreignization and Domestication.
sentences.chinese: 這就是歸化與異化相互作用的結果。

sentences.english: This article discusses the temples and lamas in the Guihua region.
sentences.chinese: 本文探討歸化城的寺廟與喇嘛。

sentences.english: what we think of today as naturalization.
sentences.chinese: 是今天我們認爲的歸化。

sentences.english: Domesticating and foreignizing are the two main translation strategies.
sentences.chinese: 歸化與異化是兩大翻譯策略。

sentences.english: Guihua City played a very delicate role in the war between the Qing Dynasty and Zunghar for about seventy years.
sentences.chinese: 歸化城在清準戰爭中處於一種極爲微妙的地位。

definition: Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
to die of old age/to live to a ripe old age/(fig.) (of sth) to come to an end (after a long period of service)
to shave one's head/fig. to become a monk or nun/to take the tonsure
to surrender and pay allegiance to
official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
